text: The 1966 Fresno State Bulldogs football team represented Fresno State CollegeCalifornia State University, Fresno was known as Fresno State College from 1949 to 1971. during the 1966 NCAA College Division football season. The team was led by first-year head coach Darryl Rogers and played home games at Ratcliffe Stadium on the campus of Fresno City College in Fresno, California. They finished the season with a record of seven wins and three losses (7–3, 3–2 CCAA). ==Schedule== ==Team players in the NFL/AFL== The following were selected in the 1967 NFL Draft. {|class="wikitable" width="65%" |- align="center" style="background:#A81933;color:#FFFFFF;" | Player || Position || Round || Overall || NFL team |- align="center" bgcolor="" | Bill Wilsey || Linebacker || 10 || 246 || Pittsburgh Steelers |- align="center" bgcolor="" | Walt Richardson || Defensive tackle || 14 || 356 || Los Angeles Rams |} The following finished their college career in 1966, were not drafted, but played in the AFL. {|class="wikitable" width="65%" |- align="center" style="background:#A81933;color:#FFFFFF;" | Player || Position || First AFL team |- align="center" bgcolor="" | Curt Frazier || Defensive back || 1968 Cincinnati Bengals |} ==Notes== ==References== Fresno State Category:Fresno State Bulldogs football seasons Fresno State Bulldogs f
